alert.note: Alert for Broward; Collier; Glades; Hendry; Mainland Monroe; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 26 at 2:36AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall Possible Across South Florida Today Into Early This Week... The forecast models are showing an area of low pressure developing over Western Atlantic Waters drifting southwest across near or over South Florida through early this week. This will allow for deep tropical moisture to work into South Florida from the tropics with PWAT values getting up to around 2 inches which is near the 90th percentile range for this time of year. The steering flow will also be light over the region allowing for slow moving storms. Therefore, heavy rainfall will be possible today into early this week over South Florida with any showers or thunderstorms that do develop. At this time the forecast models are showing rainfall totals between 1 to 3 inches possible across South Florida with locally higher amounts with any training of showers or thunderstorms this today into early this week. WPC has also put all of South Florida in a Marginal Risk of Flooding for today and Monday. Interests across all of South Florida are strongly encouraged to monitor the latest information from the National Weather Service in Miami, Florida.
